title: WHIRLING F2 / KIM PAPERWORK
description: checking out some of kim's official paperwork on his room desk

dialogueTree.title: Half-Finished Paperwork: "These are fragments of the lieutena..."
dialogueTree.text: These are fragments of the lieutenant's paperwork, left unfinished. Notes on this and other recent cases.

links.title: You: ""Look, Cuno, Lieutenant Kitsuragi's..."
links.text: "Look, Cuno, Lieutenant Kitsuragi's notes."

links.title: Cuno: "The boy picks up the notes and shuf..."
links.text: The boy picks up the notes and shuffles through some of the case names: "'The Child', 'Dom's Unfinished', 'Dom's Unfinished 2', 'The Man With the Hole in His Head'... Boring ass shit," he concludes.

links.title: Cuno: ""Oh... 'Motorcycle Emptiness' -- th..."
links.text: "Oh... 'Motorcycle Emptiness' -- that's a cool case. Cuno can solve that shit for the bino."

links.title: You: ""Don't call him a *bino*.""
links.text: "Don't call him a *bino*."

links.title: Cuno: "The boy hesitates for a moment, the..."
links.text: The boy hesitates for a moment, then nods. "No one tells Cuno what to call something, but the bino was alright in Cuno's book." He taps his chest solemnly. "Cuno's pig."

links.title: You: ""Yeah, Kim is such a binoclard.""
links.text: "Yeah, Kim is such a binoclard."

links.title: Cuno: ""Pig..." he says with a frown. "It'..."
links.text: "Pig..." he says with a frown. "It's cool for Cuno to rip on the 'clard, but he took a bullet for you. You gonna shitmouth Cuno too if he falls in battle?"

links.title: You: ""It just good-humoured banter among..."
links.text: "It just good-humoured banter among friends."

links.title: Cuno: ""For you, maybe," he replies seriou..."
links.text: "For you, maybe," he replies seriously. "But take it from the Cunn: Binos don't always get that. They get their feelings hurt. Cuno doesn't want this for your pal. He's alright in Cuno's book."

links.title: Empathy: "He's right, you know? The lieutenan..."
links.text: He's right, you know? The lieutenant probably doesn't enjoy being called a binoclard -- the four-eyed dork.

links.title: You: ""I call it like I see it, Cuno.""
links.text: "I call it like I see it, Cuno."

links.title: Cuno: ""That's cold, Pig. Sub-zero. Cuno a..."
links.text: "That's cold, Pig. Sub-zero. Cuno ain't like that. Cuno's got heart." He looks at the notes. "You're done with these or...?"

links.title: You: ""You're right, I shouldn't call him..."
links.text: "You're right, I shouldn't call him that."

links.title: Cuno: "He nods approvingly. "Now, let's ge..."
links.text: He nods approvingly. "Now, let's get a move on, pig. Cuno's itching to crack this case."

links.title: You: "What has he written -- on *this* ca..."
links.text: What has he written -- on *this* case?

links.title: Half-Finished Paperwork: "Very little. This is a daily write-..."
links.text: Very little. This is a daily write-up. He's just started copying notes from his notebook, preparing them for filing. The case appears to be named, however.

links.title: You: "What is the name?"
links.text: What is the name?

links.title: Half-Finished Paperwork: "HDB41-0803.1300 (THE HANGED MAN)"
links.text: HDB41-0803.1300 (THE HANGED MAN)

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Twenty-eight kilometres to the nort..."
links.text: Twenty-eight kilometres to the northeast, in the infirmary of Precinct 57, Lieutenant Kim 'Pinball' Kitsuragi rests under a heart monitor. A triage sign coloured yellow hangs from his injury record -- safe, it means. He coughs, propped up against the pillow.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: ""Why are you here?" asks the man as..."
links.text: "Why are you here?" asks the man as the cough fit resides. His eyes are black and moist.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: ""To inquire about the Lieutenant-Ye..."
links.text: "To inquire about the Lieutenant-Yefreitor, sir. I am his partner," says Satellite-Officer Jean Vicquemare, standing in the doorway.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: ""Then why are you wasting time here..."
links.text: "Then why are you wasting time here?" coughs Kim. "He's out there. In Martinaise. Unsupervised, *without cover*. You need to get there..." His cough gets the best of him, he grabs a glass.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "On his right hand side -- a little..."
links.text: On his right hand side -- a little blue notebook. Open at case notes...

links.title: Conceptualization: "He went with the 'Furies'. Perhaps..."
links.text: He went with the 'Furies'. Perhaps the internal strife it implies was not so off after all? Or perhaps to honour your wishes? Or for some other reason. Hard to say...

links.title: Half-Finished Paperwork: "HDB41-0803.1111 (THE HANGED MAN)"
links.text: HDB41-0803.1111 (THE HANGED MAN)

links.title: Half-Finished Paperwork: "HDB41-0803.1015 (THE HANGED MAN)"
links.text: HDB41-0803.1015 (THE HANGED MAN)

links.title: Half-Finished Paperwork: "HDB41-0803 (THE HANGED MAN)"
links.text: HDB41-0803 (THE HANGED MAN)

links.title: Half-Finished Paperwork: "KK57-0803-0815 (THE HANGED MAN)"
links.text: KK57-0803-0815 (THE HANGED MAN)

links.title: Half-Finished Paperwork: "KK57-0803-0815 (THE HANGED MAN)"
links.text: KK57-0803-0815 (THE HANGED MAN)

links.title: You: "What about the other cases? What do..."
links.text: What about the other cases? What do we have here...

links.title: Half-Finished Paperwork: "This year, you can see references t..."
links.text: This year, you can see references to: THE CHILD, DOM'S UNFINISHED; DOM'S UNFINISHED 2, MOTORCYCLE EMPTINESS, and THE MAN WITH THE HOLE IN HIS HEAD.

links.title: You: "Anything more?"
links.text: Anything more?

links.title: Half-Finished Paperwork: "Half a dozen stolen property cases..."
links.text: Half a dozen stolen property cases titled CROSSWORD PUZZLES 2-2000.

links.title: You: "[Close the notes.]"
links.text: [Close the notes.]

dialogueTree.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I am sure neither of us feels soli..."
dialogueTree.text: "I am sure neither of us feels solid enough to keep loitering in this room -- let's go."

dialogueTree.title: Half-Finished Paperwork: "These papers bear the stamp of the..."
dialogueTree.text: These papers bear the stamp of the RCM. They appear to be fragments of the lieutenant's paperwork, half-finished. You make out notes on this -- and other recent cases.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I had Garte open the door to your..."
links.text: "I had Garte open the door to your room." He closes the notes. "You were running a low bacterial fever the first night."

links.title: You: ""Thank you for keeping this... thin..."
links.text: "Thank you for keeping this... thing alive a little longer." (Point to yourself.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It would have been easy were it no..."
links.text: "It would have been easy were it not for my concussion... We both got lucky, considering the odds we faced." There's a pause. "Let's go?"

links.title: You: ""I'm such a burden. I should just f..."
links.text: "I'm such a burden. I should just fuck off..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Not this again... you pull your we..."
links.text: "Not this again... you pull your weight, okay?" He waves you off. "Let's go."

links.title: You: ""I saw... apocalyptic visions. Of t..."
links.text: "I saw... apocalyptic visions. Of the darkness... behind darkness... *behind* darkness..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""... behind darkness, I get it. Let..."
links.text: "... behind darkness, I get it. Let's go."

links.title: You: ""I thought I was dead for a moment.""
links.text: "I thought I was dead for a moment."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Back there, on the plaza? I think..."
links.text: "Back there, on the plaza? I think you very nearly had a heart attack. Alcoholism has damaged you more than bullets have..." There's a small pause. "We should go."
